They have a limited menu and although many things have changed here to line up with the menus at the rest of the BJs be prepared for things to be different. I wish things could go back to the way they used to be here. Food is ok, maybe better than other BJs. Long waits for everything. Don't come here in a hurry or just call ahead and get to go.

TERRIBLE SERVICE. Waited for 10 mins until we were greeted even though it wasn't busy, waitress was chewing gum (very obviously), the manager seemed careless considering everyone was standing around drinking Starbucks (except the ONE Busser, he was good). Limited menu but the food was good. Beach and edinger location is better hands down.
I love Bj's Pizza. i have dreams about the artichoke pizza.  Kinky, cheesy, saucy dreams.  Ok, so maybe I really love BJ's pizza.

Really fun BJs, never knew there was one here in Newport. Parking sucks but the food and server were great. Nutty Brewnette bear was amazing alongside a cigar and beef dip. Pazookie at the end never hurts either.
I saw and found COCKROACHES everywhere and our server with a annoy high pitch voice keep flirting with my dad and bumping her butt against him.....

Watch out when going to this location--it is much smaller than the regular ones and their menu is therefore limited also. Their salad selections in particular are down to the basics--caesar, wedge, and maybe one more. I think they only have beer and wine here too.  The crowd is hit and miss, one time I was here and the whole place was packed with junior high girls and their mother's, other times its been super empty.

wow... great location!!! our navigation took us through Newport beach auto ferry.. first time ever.. fun fun!! BJ here is small but very cozy.. and very close to the beach.  close to plenty of parking. Food is as expected from BJ.. service.. decent.  But LOCATION!!!

Hard to find if you are driving, especially at night. Although rather small it has a nice interior. We ordered quite a few of the appetizers as well as our entrees and all was tasty and well portioned. Price was not bad, especially for the appetizers. Service was ok, and wait wasn't too bad (went on a week night)
They make awesome mojito here, not too strong not too citrus-y . Not every places get it right.
The food was ok. But as we were waiting to get served a roach walked on the back of our booth. YUCK!

I know it is tragically uncool to like chain restaurant food. I don't freaking care. I like BJs. They have an extensive menu loaded with pizzas, salads, sandwiches, pastas and even baked potatoes. But if you ask me what the best thing on the menu is, it is the Pizookie. Damn that thing is delicious. Its like your own personal cookie cake, you know, the kind you see at Mrs. Fields and you always hope someone will get you on your birthday... only this one is covered in ice cream! The food is pretty standard here, not bad, not great... the only reason I am giving this location a 2 instead of a 3, the service 9 times out of 10 is AWFUL. I have honestly had some of the worst service I have ever had in my life here. I will probably be back, because Balboa is small and there are limited options within walking distance, but if you are torn between this and Ruby's Diner, go to Ruby's Diner...
I stopped in for a quick bite while out for a walk along the beach. There was no wait, the service was friendly, the food fresh and satisfying, and the berry cider delicious!

Location was great, beer was good, but ordered the spaghetti with meat sauce and ended up on the toilet the entire night.  I don't know if I got food poisoning or what, but I would double check the food before I eat anything.  It was so bad had to take off work the next day to sleep because I couldn't get any sleep the night before.  It was horrible.

How can I be the first to review BJ'S??? LOVE IT!! have been coming to this location for years and might actually be relocating down the street with the husbo. The pizza is AWESOME! We always get the same thing. Husbo starts us off with a pitcher of the berry burst cider and he gets minestrone soup. Then we get the pizza 1/2 sweet pig and 1/2 BJ's favorite. Then you can't leave without a pizzookie!!!! You can get that 1/2 and 1/2 too. This is not a good place to eat often though - TOO FATTENING!!

Smaller than most BJ's, but still has a great atmosphere.  It can get loud downstairs, but the balcony is much better for conversations.   BJ's has my favorite pizza ever - have a BJ's classic combo with a Jeremiah Red and bask in the perfection.

Ate at this BJ's on 12/29 with a party of 5. -Unfortunately, the power went out twice during our visit. -Fortunately, the wait staff and manager were all extremely helpful and pleasant, and the manager more than once offered to allow us to skip out on our tab even though the power outage was beyond their control (nor did it adversely affect our visit). As other reviewers have indicated, this location is smaller than other BJ's, but I will definitely be back, thanks mostly to their service.
Such a great location. It's a super small BJ's which makes it great. Took a walk down the boardwalk and then stopped in and ate delicious pizza.

Nice cozy place, friendly servers, good food and beer. Smaller than most Bj's. Had the nachos and pale ale. Both were excellent! Servers did not rush us. Took walk around Balboa Island to view Christmas lights, then jumped on ferry to Balboa Pennsula and found BJ's.  After a relaxing meal we took romantic walk on Balboa pier before taking the ferry back to the Island. Nice place to take a date, noise level was just right so you could have a private conversation without the next table hearing you.

Hung out at the beach with the 12 year old today and decided he needed feeding. This is what he chose. It was about 2pm, and there were very few people there. Shame one of them was one of those undisciplined screaming devil spawn and it's oblivious, rude spawn-er. I hate you and wish bad things for you. Service was very good and attentive. I had the bbq chicken salad and broccoli cheese soup. The soup was tasty, but had cooked too long. The broccoli had turned to mush with little woody pieces. blech. The salad was good. Very generous with the chicken, loses points for not using fresh corn. My midget had the bacon cheeseburger pizza. He loved it. But he's 12. I thought it was too greasy and the sauce on top- no idea what it's supposed to be- has no business on a pizza. I felt our order took quite a while to get to us, given the light business they were doing. Overall, I'll give them another shot someday. When I want to spend $35 for lunch with no beer involved.
BJ's is great..  Good food, good beer, good pazookie..  The pizza is bomb, the french dip sandwhich is bomb, the waitresses at the HB location are gorgeous and very friendly.

I go to this BJ's and the one on Jamboree in Tustin depending on what type of mood I'm in.  This one is quieter, more family oriented.  I even once went here with a book and got some studying done while gut-busting on a pizza.  No full bar at this location kind of sets the tone.  It has a less corporate feel and the staff is smaller and seems more tight knit.  You can't go wrong with servers Marcie or Jane.  Be nice and they might hook it up!  This place really works for unwinding on evenings during the week.  The food is quality and if there's something wrong just let them know.  If you are in a rowdier mood check out the one in Tustin.
Diego at the Newport restaurant is second only to the old school blacken chicken pizza with Alfredo sauce.
I always go here when I go to new port. Its right by the beach and all the little shops. I love the pizza and beer. Also the wedge salad is very refreshing and tasty.

I love this BJ's, its location is great but full of children, families and babies. It isnt your normal BJ's with a bar area. It is very small capacity, and they only serve their brews. The menu is paired down, but still has all of the favorites. I would say if you go on a weekend to expect a wait, but its the best place to eat in the area for a reasonable price and the food is always delicious.

I love BJ's!   Just not this one.  I figured I'd never been down to the Newport one and I was with an out of town guest so it I could kill two birds with one stone by taking him to BJ's @ the Beach.  The menu was a fraction of the size as normal.  It was tight and cramped.  And of course there was no parking.

Always have had friendly efficient service at this location.  The atmosphere is upbeat and usually on the fun side.  It's a little tight inside if they are busy, but their craft beers help ease that pain.  We usually order a deep dish pizza made our way, and have always enjoyed.  Nice place to eat and casually hang out at for a while after an afternoon at the beach.  The location is walking distance from the water.
